data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly for Search Engine Dominance
data.Description: A federal judge has ruled that Google is a monopolist, citing its practice of paying billions of dollars to companies like Apple to secure its position as the default search engine on various platforms. This landmark decision could have significant implications for Google's business practices and the future of internet search.

data.Title: Apple Confirms Maintaining Its Own Web Search Index
data.Description: As part of the DOJ's antitrust case against Google, it was revealed that Apple maintains its own search index of "billions" of websites. While the exact number was redacted, the revelation sheds light on Apple's potential search capabilities and future plans.

data.Title: Google Ads Experiences Glitch, Issues Million-Dollar Credits by Mistake
data.Description: Google Ads accidentally issued million-dollar ad credits to some Local Service Ads advertisers due to a bug. Google has acknowledged the error and is working to resolve the issue and correct the credit amounts.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Now Display Photos, Impacting Ad Rank
data.Description: Google Local Service Ads will now showcase photos from advertisers' profiles, potentially influencing ad ranking. This update emphasizes the importance of visual content optimization for businesses using Local Service Ads.

data.Title: Study Suggests Traffic Decline for Websites Engaged in Backlink Selling
data.Description: A recent study indicates a decline in traffic for websites involved in selling backlinks, despite the practice being widespread. The findings have ignited debate within the SEO community regarding ethical SEO strategies and the effectiveness of backlink purchasing.

data.Title: Google Search Testing "You May Like" Labels for Snippets
data.Description: Google is experimenting with new "You May Like" labels for search result snippets, aiming to personalize search results and display content aligned with users' interests. The feature's functionality and how Google determines user preferences remain unclear.

data.Title: Googlebot's Crawling Behavior: Following Links or Collecting Them?
data.Description: Google's Gary Illyes has sparked confusion by stating that Googlebot collects links rather than "following" them, contradicting official documentation. This discrepancy raises questions about Google's crawling mechanisms and how websites are indexed.

data.Title: Google Tests New Short Video Loading Behavior in Search Results
data.Description: Google is experimenting with how short videos load in search results. Instead of dynamically loading them, Google is testing a method requiring users to click a "more videos" button to access a dedicated short videos tab.

data.Title: Google Ads to Migrate Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will soon transition Smart Campaign functionality into Performance Max campaigns. Google claims that Performance Max offers all the benefits of Smart Campaigns and more, prompting advertisers to adapt to the platform update.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report No Longer Shows Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report has stopped displaying the "call" tab, which provided statistics and data on calls generated from Google Search and Maps. This change might be related to the previously reported removal of Google Business Profile call history.
